intro: Sisymbrium gaubae, commonly known as the Gaubae babysteps, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Sisymbrium gaubae is often found in rocky soils and is a part of the local flora in regions like Namibia and South Africa.
